intro: Gonolobus australis, commonly known as the Australian crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and can be dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution along the coastline. Gonolobus australis is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
